major_arcana_info.name: Tarot Major Arcana
major_arcana_info.description: The 22 cards of the Major Arcana representing the soul's journey
major_arcana_info.purpose: Major life themes, spiritual lessons, and archetypal energies
major_arcana_info.journey: The Fool's Journey from innocence to enlightenment

the_fools_journey.description: The Major Arcana tells the story of the soul's evolution

0.name: The Fool
0.upright_meaning: New beginnings, innocence, spontaneity, free spirit, adventure, idealism, inexperience
0.reversed_meaning: Recklessness, taken advantage of, inconsideration, foolishness, lack of direction
0.description: The Fool represents new beginnings, having faith in the future, being inexperienced, not knowing what to expect, having beginner's luck, improvisation and believing in the universe.
0.spiritual_lesson: Trust in the journey and embrace new experiences with an open heart
0.archetypal_energy: The innocent child, the divine fool, pure potential
0.journey_stage: Beginning - Pure potential and infinite possibility

1.name: The Magician
1.upright_meaning: Manifestation, resourcefulness, power, inspired action, desire, creation, confidence
1.reversed_meaning: Manipulation, poor planning, untapped talents, lack of energy, lack of confidence
1.description: The Magician represents manifestation, resourcefulness, power, inspired action, desire, creation and confidence. He has the tools and ability to manifest his desires.
1.spiritual_lesson: You have all the tools you need to create your reality
1.archetypal_energy: The creator, the manifestor, focused will
1.journey_stage: Learning to use personal power and will

2.name: The High Priestess
2.upright_meaning: Intuition, sacred knowledge, divine feminine, subconscious mind, inner voice, mystery
2.reversed_meaning: Secrets, disconnected from intuition, withdrawal, silence, repressed feelings
2.description: The High Priestess represents intuition, sacred knowledge, divine feminine, subconscious mind and inner voice. She is the guardian of the unconscious.
2.spiritual_lesson: Trust your intuition and inner wisdom
2.archetypal_energy: The wise woman, the oracle, divine feminine wisdom

3.name: The Empress
3.upright_meaning: Femininity, beauty, nature, nurturing, abundance, fertility, creativity, sensuality
3.reversed_meaning: Creative block, dependence on others, smothering, lack of growth, lack of progress
3.description: The Empress represents femininity, beauty, nature, nurturing and abundance. She is the mother figure who creates and nurtures life.
3.spiritual_lesson: Embrace your creative and nurturing nature
3.archetypal_energy: The mother, the creator, abundant nature

4.name: The Emperor
4.upright_meaning: Authority, structure, control, father figure, leadership, stability, security, discipline
4.reversed_meaning: Tyranny, rigidity, coldness, lack of discipline, lack of control, abusive power
4.description: The Emperor represents authority, structure, control and father figure. He is the masculine principle of leadership and order.
4.spiritual_lesson: Learn to use authority and power responsibly
4.archetypal_energy: The father, the ruler, structured authority

5.name: The Hierophant
5.upright_meaning: Spiritual wisdom, religious beliefs, conformity, tradition, institutions, teaching, learning
5.reversed_meaning: Personal beliefs, freedom, challenging the status quo, unconventional methods
5.description: The Hierophant represents spiritual wisdom, religious beliefs, conformity, tradition and institutions. He is the bridge between heaven and earth.
5.spiritual_lesson: Find your own spiritual path while respecting tradition
5.archetypal_energy: The teacher, the priest, spiritual authority

6.name: The Lovers
6.upright_meaning: Love, harmony, relationships, values alignment, choices, partnerships, unity
6.reversed_meaning: Disharmony, imbalance, misalignment of values, relationship problems, inner conflict
6.description: The Lovers represents love, harmony, relationships and values alignment. It's about making choices based on love and values.
6.spiritual_lesson: Choose love and align with your highest values
6.archetypal_energy: The lover, divine union, conscious choice
6.journey_stage: Learning about love and making conscious choices

7.name: The Chariot
7.upright_meaning: Control, willpower, success, determination, direction, focus, hard work paying off
7.reversed_meaning: Lack of control, lack of direction, aggression, obstacles, scattered energy
7.description: The Chariot represents control, willpower, success and determination. It's about moving forward with focus and determination.
7.spiritual_lesson: Master your emotions and direct your will toward your goals
7.archetypal_energy: The warrior, the conqueror, directed will

21.name: The World
21.upright_meaning: Completion, integration, accomplishment, travel, fulfillment, success, cosmic consciousness
21.reversed_meaning: Incomplete goals, lack of closure, seeking external validation, delays
21.description: The World represents completion, integration, accomplishment and fulfillment. It's the successful end of the Fool's journey.
21.spiritual_lesson: Celebrate your achievements and prepare for the next cycle
21.journey_stage: Completion and integration of all lessons learned

reading_applications.spiritual_guidance: Major Arcana cards indicate major life themes and spiritual lessons
reading_applications.life_cycles: Cards show where you are in your personal development journey
reading_applications.archetypal_energies: Each card represents universal human experiences
reading_applications.timing: Major Arcana often indicates longer-term influences
reading_applications.personal_growth: Cards reveal areas for spiritual and psychological development

integration_with_other_systems.astrology: Each card corresponds to astrological signs and planets
integration_with_other_systems.kabbalah: Cards map to paths on the Tree of Life
integration_with_other_systems.elements: Cards connect to the four classical elements
integration_with_other_systems.chakras: Cards can be associated with different energy centers
